block.p: The NEC Corporation of Japan returned to profitability in the six months ended Sept. 30, posting a net group profit of 20.5 billion yen ($190 million). That compared with a net loss of 51.1 billion yen ($472.5 million) in the comparable period last year. The chip manufacturer enjoyed robust orders from cellular phone and personal computer makers struggling to meet demand. The company expects strong sales of chips and PC's to continue and forecast a full-year net profit of 90 billion yen ($832.3 million). Shares of NEC fell 120 yen ($1.11), to 2,115 yen ($19.56).
